bill_title: require the South Dakota State Library to continue to circulate popular books to citizens and to ensure that records are reviewed for historical significance before being discarded.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require the South Dakota State Library to continue to circulate popular books to citizens and to ensure that records are reviewed for historical significance before being discarded. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 14-1-44 be amended to read as follows: 14-1-44. The State Library Office shall be responsible for executing the library policy of the State of South Dakota and shall: (1) Promote adequate library service for all the people of the state; (2) Supplement the services of libraries throughout the state; (3) Increase the proficiency of library personnel through provision of in-service and continuing education programs for library personnel employed in the state; (4) Provide for the citizens of the state specialized library services and materials not generally appropriate, economical, or available in other libraries of the state; (5) Maintain a collection of popular books at its central location in Pierre which shall be circulated to citizens; (6) Ensure that no book or other record within its collection is discarded or destroyed without first being evaluated for any historical significance it may possess in accordance with policies formulated by the state archivist pursuant to § 1-18C-4; (5) (7) Coordinate the libraries maintained by the executive department of state government within the governmental complex in Pierre; (6) (8) Establish and operate a state publications library distribution center; and (7) (9) Collect and publish annual statistical data of libraries in the state.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
